alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Franklin; Harlan; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 23 at 2:57AM CDT until April 23 at 3:30AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Smith County in north central Kansas... Phillips County in north central Kansas... Franklin County in south central Nebraska... Phelps County in south central Nebraska... Western Kearney County in south central Nebraska... Southwestern Buffalo County in south central Nebraska... Harlan County in south central Nebraska... * Until 330 AM CDT. * At 256 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Loomis to Orleans to 9 miles north of Phillipsburg to near Speed, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Holdrege, Alma and Loomis around 300 AM CDT. Funk around 305 AM CDT. Phillipsburg, Republican City and Huntley around 310 AM CDT. Odessa around 315 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Kirwin, Naponee, Ragan, Agra, Bloomington, Kearney, Franklin, Kensington, Hildreth and Wilcox. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 255 and 279. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
